page.title: 15Bourne Avenue
page.content:
On the way to Bourne Avenue we passed a field under a bridge where there were horses, goats and donkeys. At the beginning of Bourne Avenue there was an old peoples home. It was mainly semi-detached and terraced houses. The road wasn't very busy and it was people aged 40 and over who lived in the houses. The air smelt clean and there wasn't many cars along the pavement. At the end of Bourne Avenue there was a general store and a pub and wine bar. Right at the end was a record office. All of the roads leading off were built up with houses apart from the one that lead to Pinkwell Park.
by Lee Budd
